sentences.english: An empty head or a blank mind which leads to speechlessness--that is silence.
sentences.chinese: 腹中空泛，思想一片苍白，故无言可发，这是沉默。

sentences.english: Nowadays, the mind of local young people is so empty and lifeless as if they were over-exploited.
sentences.chinese: 现今，当地年轻人的思想空泛，似乎是被骄纵的一代。

sentences.english: The rich sometimes complain their empty life.
sentences.chinese: 穷人有时挟恨他们空泛的生活。

sentences.english: This wishy-washy statement always made me felt uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 这种空泛的声明总是使我感到不安。

sentences.english: Or children of Agriculture and Commerce, which said that the theory more vague and noble.
sentences.chinese: 或其农商子弟，其说多空泛高尚之论。

sentences.english: Eg. These objectives should not extend tenuously to preserving cultural traditions.
sentences.chinese: 不应该空泛地把这些目标计划扩展到保护文化传统。

definition: empty cave, nothing there (idiom); devoid of substance/nothing new to show
grandiose but impractical (idiom)/large but of no real use
(of a writing etc) to have no substance (idiom)/to carry no weight
to float about/(of a feeling) to show on the face/(of speech, friendship etc) shallow/vague
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
not to the point/wide of the mark/neither here nor there/irrelevant
